East River Drive, east side, at the foot of East 8th Street, showing the W.P.A. clearing this river side of this new Drive of shacks and other encumbrances.

October 8, 1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

East River Drive, south from East 8th Street. Bridge shown is the Williamsburg.

June 1st, 1939.

East River Drive, south from East 8th Street, showing this waterfront area prior to improvement. The various piers and buildings abutting the shore are to be removed and their sites filled in for the new East River Park. This will skirt the waters edge. The new marginal high-way is shown at the right and is partially complete at this date. In the background is the Williamsburg Bridge.

1-2-4: Feb. 23, 1937
3: Apr. 5, 1937

W. P. A., photo
Five Boroughs Project

East River Drive, south from East 8th Street, showing this waterfront prior to fill for the new park. The new marginal highway is at the right and has included the former Lewis Street. In the background is the Williamsburg Bridge.
